intro: Salacia tessmanniana, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with dark centers, which resemble the eyes of the Susan. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. Salacia tessmanniana typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
